inn1.comm: back of a length well outside off stump, left alone by Tharanga
straighter one, drifting in a tad, and its nicely tucked just wide of square leg for one to get off the mark, Patel gives chase
back of a length well outside off stump, low carry through to the 'keeper as Jayasuriya shuffles and leaves it be
fuller this time, and he gets well forward and defend into the covers, compact defence there
back of a length outside off stump, he shuffles hurriedly and uses soft hands to push in front of point for a very risky single
too full and angling down leg stump, wide called
overpitched outside off stump, he square-drives uneasily and manages to find the gap where gulley could be, runs it down to third man for one
poor ball to start off with, quite wide down leg stump, work for McCullum
back of a length, pitching on middle and off and angling well away as Tharanga leaves it alone
drifts down leg stump, and Tharanga neatly tickles it off the hips and picks up an easy four to fine leg, no swing whatsoever for Bond
looking for the yorker, he overpitches on leg stump and it swings away, theres a noise as Tharanga shuffles across and bends down, late movement there, no signal from the umpire
again he strays down leg stump and again Tharanga tickles it fine, Franklin runs across and dives on the ropes but cant stop it, four more
better, on the stumps, he gets behind the line and defends it back to Bond
well bowled! Lands it on a great length and gets it to slant past Tharanga, who stands rooted and plays forward, only to see the ball shave past his bat
good length on off stump, he gets forward and defends it to point
back of a length on off stump, he shuffles and turns it straight to square leg

cleaned 'em up! Full outside off stump, swings in enough to lure Jayasuriya forward and flick across the line, only to miss it all ends up and hear the death rattle behind him! Franklin roars out his delight! Thats a big, big wicket early
full on off stump again, but Sangakkara manages to get over it and flick it well in the gap at midwicket for early runs
short of a length outside off stump, he gets across and defends, and gets an edge along the ground wide of second slip for one out to third man
wide of off stump, theres that low carry again as he shoulders arms to it
good length on off stump, gets some purchase off the surface to surprise Sangakarra as he shuffles across
banged in short on the stums, he gets into position and pulls along the ground in the gap in front of square
back of a length moving across from off stump, he gets behind the line and defends to point
bouncer! Drops it in short and quick and forces Tharanga down onto his haunches
back of a length on off stump, he drives with zero footwork and Taylor dives full length at point to save runs
too full outside leg stump again
overpitched outside off stump, he square-drives in the gap behind point for one to third man
strays to leg stump, worked behind square leg for a single
good length outside off stump, he comes well forward and defends to the off
back of a length outside off stump, defended into the ground
back of a length again, he gets behind the line and defends
oversteps, the ball is full outside off stump and left alone
full on off stump, he drives at it and manages to just turn the wrists to pick up one between midwicket and mid-on
fullish outside off stump, he gets forward and plays it late, pushing in the gap at point and picking up four, positive shot
good length on the stumps, flicked straight to Patel at square leg
back of a length angling away outside off stump, he gets a brain freeze and has a full-blooded swish at it, only to get beaten comprehensively
fuller this time, pushed neatly to mid-off
another no-ball, good length outside off stump and he defends to cover
fuller and moving well across from off stump, the slower ball, and it stays low as Sangakkara leaves it be
short of a length outside off stump, he reaches for it and manages to edge it well in the gap at gulley for one to third man
short of a length outside off stump again, his feet go nowhere as he plays at it away from his body, the ball speeds down to third man and beats the fielder's dive
slow one outside off stump, full, he drives and gets an inside-edge back onto the pad
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and defends
back of a length on off stump, he gets behind it and defends down the track
good length on off stump, neatly on-driven to mid-on
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and defends it to point
short of a length outside off stump, he cuts late and well over it to get one down to third man
back of a length outside off stump, he gets onto the backfoot and punches to cover
short outside off stump, he gets across and pulls hard to midwicket
good length angling away from off stump, he gets over it and defends to cover
back of a length angling away again, now he gets across and watches it through to the 'keeper
bends his back a bit, landing it on a good length outside off stump, Sangakkara gets a step in and lets it be
a gift, a full toss outside off stump, but all he can do is drive to point, missed out on a freebie
shot! Good length outside off stump, he eases into it and caresses a drive in the gap smack between cover and point and the outfield does the rest
half-volley outside off stump, waits for it and just drives excellently past mid-off for four, lovely, off the middle of the bat, all timing
good length just outside off stump, now he comes forward and defends
a tad fuller, he comes onto the front foot and drives to cover
good length moving in from off stump, he looks to defend it to the on side and gets an inside-edge to square leg
a touch too full, but by no means a half-volley, and he times a good-looking drive past point again for a brace
well bowled, full in the blockhole, he falls over but manages to squeeze it out to point
back of a length moving in from outside off stump, tucks it into midwicket for a single
oversteps, the ball's short of a length outside off stump, plays it with an open face and picks up one to third man
good length just outside off stump, he defends it into the covers
full on the stumps, he shuffles across and drives to midwicket, cant beat the gap though
full on off stump again, driven back to Franklin
good length outside off stump, he comes onto the front foot and defends
full length from around the wicket, outside off and Tharanga pushes his front foot forward and thumps it straight to cover. Well timed, not that well placed
bounced over the stumps, he gets down and lets it sail over his shoulder
short of a length outside off stump, he stands and chases it, hitting on the up, and   just manages to get  it over a leaping backward point...very close!
fuller, quicker, he stands and throws the kitchen sink at it, and connects with air
fullish outside off stump, driven to point
overpitched outside off stump, driven straight to point again
short of a length outside off stump, he shuffles across, waits for it, gets ovet it and runs it down to third man
full, slower outside off stump, he shuffles across and drives, only to get beaten by the little bit of swing
back of a length outside off stump, works it to the on side via the inside-edge
short of a length outside off stump, there are no slips in place, so he stands leaden-footed and flashes the bat at it, and the ball flies away for four
fuller on off stump, he drives back down the ground, beating the bowler's left hand and mid-on and mid-off have to give chase
fullish outside off stump, he stands and drives at it, in no control of that shot whatsoever, driving on the up, but hes got enough on it to time it over Vettori at mid-off
and the reply is a quick, shorter one outside off stump, which he flashes at and misses
close! Uses the feet to come out, bowler fires it short and wide, he looks to pull out of the shot and just manages to jam bat onto it, and the inside-edge carries it to fine leg
short and wide, cut right to point on the bounce
fuller, driven to mid-off
back of a length on the stumps, shuffles and angles it to square leg
good length on off stump, rolls the wrists and taps it to square leg
good length outside off stump, comes forward and drives to point
gone! Soft dismissal, comes down the track, chips it across the line and can only find Fleming, diving forward just a little, at mid-on, to end whats been a very sluggish innings
good length on the stumps, gets over it and defends to point
angled across him on a length, he gets his eye in and shoulders arms
good length on off stump, he gets behind the line and defends it back to Franklin
good length on off stump, just gets forward and defends
back of a length on the stumps, he gets behind the line and taps it to the on side
short of a length outside off stump, he hops up and plays it to backward point
oversteps, Tharanga stands and flirts with a slower one pretty close to the body, and misses
back of a length on middle and leg, turned off the hips straight to square leg
back of a length on off stump, he stands up and defends it back to Oram
comes into him off a short length, too close to cut, he hops up and steers it to third man
good length on the stumps, and he defends to point
good length outside off stump, defended to point

Franklin from around the wicket, straight and full, Tharanga tries to work away to the leg side and is rapped on the pads, huge appeal for lbw but Taufel says no. Batsmen scamper a leg bye and replays show that Tharanga is very lucky there. That was probably going on to hit the top of middle
full and on off, defended confidently to the on side. Jayawardene can be a shaky starter, once set he is a delight to watch
pushed to the off side again, Franklin whips the bails off with his left foot (while following through)
off the mark with a single, tapped away to the point region and completes a quick single
driven confidently to mid-off, full and pushed cleanly. Tharanga seems to have found his groove, despite having a forgettable World Cup so far

slightly wide, not that short but Tharanga latches on. Flashes that with timing and gets it past the diving point for a rasping four. He's stylish, he's confident and these are great signs for Sri Lanka
slightly slower ball from Oram, straight and full. Jayawardene pats it to the on side tamely. The policy seems to be: wait for the loose ones
solid defence again, Jayawardene gets behind the line and gets his head over the ball well.
tapped to the off side solidly, not taking any chances with Oram's nagging length.
slightly wide and Jayawardene cuts it cutely behind point for a single

cut away for a single, not that wide again but Tharanga gets on the back foot and slaps it towards cover for a single. It keeps slightly low and he makes allowance for that by keeping his eyes on the ball till the last moment
worked away confidently again. Jaywardene doing it just right, it seems
Franklin drifting onto the pads this time and Tharanga, with those gifted wrists, turns it away elegantly for a single. They think of two but don't take the chance
angled away from the left-hander. 135kph that time and Jayawardene, in this present mood, has nothing to do with it. Even while shouldering arms, there is a bit of style with Mahela
short ball, quicker and well directed, Jayawardene goes for the pull but it beats him for pace and rattles the bat on the splice. Tamely trickles to the leg side
full and wide, Jayawardene thinks about throwing his bat at it but backs away in the last moment. Taufel thinks about calling a wide but those arms don't signal anything
pushed to the off side, straight to the cover fielder. Full and wide again and Jayawardene seems angry with himself for not putting it away
slightly short, slightly wide, bat out, flash, down to third man for a single. The game seems to be entering a slightly lazy period. Time for some fizz
good length ball, angling into his pads and that's chipped away wide of mid-on for a single. In the air for a bit but drops well short
turned away behind square leg for a single. Powerplay is on but not too many bnoundaries here. Well done NZ
on the pads again and Jayawardene ticks it past square leg for a brace. Well placed, well run
that's a better length, good length on and outside off, Jayawardene pushes forward and gets it off the meat of the bat, straight to cover
similar delivery, similar result. Jayawardene's tactics matching well with the sleepy atmosphere at Sabina Park. This is the World Cup semi-final and nobody seems to have woken up yet
blocked to the off, one way of getting your eye in. Oram keeping it tight and New Zealand keeping the game in control
slightly quicker one to start with, tapped away to the off side
on middle, flighted a bit and Tharanga seems to be thinking of coming down the track but changes his mind and taps it to the off side
quicker outside off, Tharanga tries to glide but is beaten. That could have been dangerous
on the pads, Vettori bowling at close to 60mph, driven straight to the square fielder
easily done, slightly wide and that was placed in the gap for a single
continues to keep it flat and quick and Jayawardene continues to block confidently

Around the wicket to the left-hander, on and outside off and Tharanga pushes to the off side and completes the single that takes him to a solid fifty. This is his 8th half-century in ODIs and third fifty against New Zealand
flighted outside off, not much turn for either spinner yet but they've begun well. Jayawardene taps it to the off side and registers yet another dot ball.
short and Jayawardene is onto it quickly, pulls it square for a single
good loop and flight from Patel, tapped away to the of side for a single
quicker one, Mahela comes down the track but Patel reads him well. He can only drop it close to his body

Oh, thrown up, flight, arrived slowly and gripped and spun as well. Jayawardene gets his foot forward and tries to flick it to the on side but can't do so. He's one of the best players of spin but Patel and Vettori giving nothing away.

Oh Taylor! missed a gimme of a run-out there! Tharanga flicks it square and Taylor fumbles before letting rip a throw to the bowler. Jayawardene is halfway down the track but the misfield allows him to get back in time

down the track, that was flighted outside off and he creams a most delicious lofted cover drive over extra cover for a most stylish six. Tharanga can hit them, he can time them, he can place them and does he do it with some class
faster ball outside off, Tharanga tries to glide it to third man but can't get bat to ball
this time he manages the glide, that's racing away but Patel dives full length at third man anc cuts off a sure boundary
that's finer and cuter and more effective. It's a delectable glide and runs away for four. 12 off the over, the highest of the innings so far. Tharanga on the move
driven to mid-on, misfield allows them to complete a single
tapped to the leg side, flat ball that time
cut away to extra cover and they go for two, the fielder fires it into the bowlers end and Jayawardene is struggling to get back. A direct hit would have been close but he makes his ground
worked away for a single. They're stepping it up now, no doubt about that
flatter on off, Jayawardene taps it to point and scampers a single
another single, this time it's Tharanga and he tucks it away and completes a quick single
quicker ball, on off and tapped to the on side. Tharanga again seems to be thinking of coming down the track but adjusts in the last moment
bit of drift, bit of flight, ball not spinning that much and holding its line. Tharanga tries the elegant back cut but is beaten.
that's the elegance, back-cut comes out this time after Vettori fires it a bit wide. Batsmen complete two behind square

New Zealand getting a bit sloppy on the field, Tharanga taps it to point and takes off for a quick single, the fielder tries the direct hit and Styris (backing up) makes a hash of it and allows two more. Styris seems to have some injury on his finger (lot of bandaging there)
another single, Sri Lanka doing it well now, after a lengthy lull

huge appeal, that drifted into the right-hander beautifully and Jayawardene couldn't get his bat onto it as he went for the forward defensive. Big appeal but Taufel says "No". Maybe he was too far forward. Just maybe
around the wicket, fast one and Tharanga pushes to the off side
flight and loop, quite a peach of an offspinner and Tharanga is a bit unsure with his footwork and beaten comprehensively by one that turns away
gets his front foot forward and pushes to the off, straight to the cover fielder
defended confidently, good bowling from Patel. Unlike, Vettori he seems to have found his rhythm
well-timed drive to the covers and yet another fumble but they decide against the single. New Zealand fumbling all over the place here, butterflies in their stomachs?

Patel throws it up, that went up a few miles before coming down, Tharanga had so much time that he seemed to be confused about what to do with it. It came down after an age and he tamely pushed to extra cover for a single

Around his legs! Cleaned him up. Vettori fires it quick and flat and on middle and leg. Tharanga chooses the wrong shot, trying to sweep past short fine, and goes way across his stumps, exposing the middle and leg. The ball is too quick for him and goes around his pads to rattle middle. Huge wicket, Dan the Man strikes
quicker ball again, slightly short, cut away for a single. Off the mark, he's not one to hang around
turned behind square on the leg side and scampers a single. Fielder goes for the direct hit but misses, that would have also been close. Jayawardene living dangerously
slower ball, draws Silva forward. He turns it away behind square on the leg for a quick single
slower, flightier, driven to long-off for an easy single
swept away to short fine but Fleming is waiting there and doesn't allow them to take any risks. Patel is mixing them up superbly here.
flight and turn, keeps Jayawardene on the back foot, tucked away to the on side cautiously
throws it up again, this is good offspin bowling, draws Mahela onto to the front foot and sees him drive crisply to long-on for a single
slightly wide of the crease, over the wicket, flighted up deliciously, turns after pitching, Silva can't read it accurately and pushes tentatively to the off
this time he pulls out the sweep, sees the full ball on off and times it well to pouch a single behind square
faster one this time, turned away for a single behind square
slightly short outside off, tapped away for a single

Silva turns his bat smartly, he plays these middle overs very well, scampers a single, Patel is quick but Jayawardene gets in just in time. He is trying his best to push these fielders and none are hitting the stumps. Wake up NZ!
full on middle, driven well to long-off for a single
over-pitched, that seems to have slipped out of his hand, Silva pushes the full toss to long-off for a single
tapped to the off side, more defence from Jayawardene
full outside off, swept away for a single
the sweep seems to be the preferred option now. Jayawardene also goes for it and gets it to fine leg for a single

Patel anticipates another sweep and sends that well outside off, Silva is upto the challenge and drives it through the covers for a single. A good cat-and-mouse battle here. Patel is holding his nerve well
flighted outside off, some turn into the right-hander, sweep attempted but can't connect, padded away, deceived, manages a single, though
turned to the off side, straight to the fielder, Fleming prowling
flatter, quicker, turned away to the leg side for a single, Silva knows the gaps, Patel knows his intentions
quicker, batsman pushes forward, half an lbw appeal goes up but they stop after realising that there was some bat there
too wide, well outside off and wide called.
better line, straighter and quicker, tapped to the on side
busy, busy, outside off and tapped away. Silva is always looking for a run and manages it this time easily. He's such a valuable player to have in these overs
pushed back to the bowler
pushed to the off side and that ends a tight over from Vettori
drifts down leg stump, McCullum whips off the bails, all safe, just a wide
back of a length on the stumps, shuffles and punches down to deep mid-on
short on off stump, and in a flash he whips into position and pulls behind square leg for four, lovely shot
back of a length outside off stump, whipped with supple wrists past square leg and they jog an easy single
back of a length on off stump, driven to mid-on
good length on off stump, goes back and turns it to midwicket
short again, sits up and he pulls uneasily into the ground just wide of midwicket
short and flat on leg, turned right to square leg
tossed up outside off stump, driven right to point this time
tossed up teasingly on the stumps, he lunges forward and defends
tossed up, holds it back in the air, lunges forward and drives in the air, pops up and falls tantalisingly in front of a diving cover
flatter now, pushed back down the track
tossed up, plants the front foot forward and defends, then turns it late to square leg
low full toss on the stumps, driven to mid-on for one
back of a length outside off stump, plants the leg out and drives wide of point for one out to the deep
good length outside off stump, he lunges forward and drives, and the thick edge scoots past backward point
overpitched, slow outside off stump, he squeezes it to point, who fumbles and allows one
well bowled, full in the zone, dug out to cover
good length outside off stump, driven off the front foot to point
short and wide, cut out to the deep cover-point fielder
comes out, he sees him and fires it quick and flat, and Silva defends
big hit! Tossed up outside off stump, he plants the leg out in front of the line, and heaves it away with awesome wrist power, up onto the second floor behind deep midwicket
short and flat, cut off the back foot into the covers
short and flat, cut off the back foot into the covers
tossed up, Silva waits for it and then rocks back to cut out past point
short and wide outside off stump, ducks under it to let it pass
short of a length outside off stump, stands and chases it, and gets beaten

unlucky! Bond switches to a fuller length, gets it to angle in from outside off stump, Silva gets stuck deep in the crease, jabs the bat down onto it, gets a relatively thick inside-edge back onto the pads - an awkward noise, if ever there was one - and after a couple of seconds Koertzen raises the finger. Unfortunate decision for Silva
full outside off stump, gets well forward, waits, and opens the face to steer it wide but not past point
back of a length on off stump, he gets airborn and rolls the wrists over it, manufacturing one past short fine leg
back of a length outside off stump, gets back and opens the face to steal one down to third man
tossed up on off stump, he gets forward and just defends
flatter on off stump, works it to square leg and jogs one
tossed up, he leans into it and drives to the man at cover
quicker, spins into him, he makes room and then hurries to cut past point
tossed up, he goes back and then drives to cover
fraction wide, he flashes a cut but cant beat the man at  backward point
tossed up, quick and flat, he comes out of the box and cashes in on the width with a hard drive through the covers
tossed up on the stumps, plays with the spin, walking into it and picking up one to midwicket
tossed up, just stays in the air a second longer and Jayawardene gets back and turns it in the air behind square
tossed up, he makes room and cuts for one
flatter outside off stump, shuffles out and on-drives to mid-on
tossed up again, waits for it and turns it around the corner for a quick single
tossed up, he waits for it and punches wide of point
tossed up, Dilshan uses the feet well and drives to long-off
quick and moving down leg stump, he uses the speed to nudge it around the corner and the ball speeds down to fine leg, all placement there
tossed up on middle and off, comes forward and rolls the wrists to pick up one
short and wide, cuts hard but straight to cover
fraction short again, now Jayawardene cuts past cover for one and he'll keep strike
tossed up outside off stump, rolls the wrists to get one
quicker one, spins back into him as he defends
spins into him off a length, makes room and late cuts with enough on it to send it speeding down to third man
tossed up, he comes out but cant connect on the drive and the ball rolls back to Patel
arm ball, flat on the stumps, worked around the corner for one
tossed up flat, he drives one-handed out to long-on for one
slower ball, loosener on the stumps, flicked to square leg for one
dropped short outside off stump, he's surprised by it but goes through with the pull, getting it past short fine leg and scampering
full on off stump, shuffles and whips it across the line to midwicket
short on the stumps, doesnt sit up at all, Jayawardene picks it early and pulls it in the gap behind square and the outfield does the rest once more
slower ball, full on the stumps again, and now he rolls the wrists for an easy single
back of a length outside off stump, poked to point
sloppy, New Zealand have been below par on the field throughout the day. Good ball from Patel, spinning in and Jayawardene glides it towards shot third man, Bond muffs and they complete two

crackling way to bring up a fifty, tossed up outside off and he walks across to loft it elegantly over midwicket, Fulton stops it well in the boundary and pushes the ball out of his hand before he cross the ropes. Good work, fine fifty. Jayawardene fifth half-centrury of the tournament.
tossed up, Patel has done this all day and kept the batsmen in two minds, pushed back to the bowler cautiously
varies his pace and length this time, pushed through full on middle, patted back down the ground for a single
down the track and gets it on the full, Dilshan is an aggressor in these overs. Can't time it as Patel pushes it through quicker and they only manage a single
solid, full face of the bat and to long-on for a single
pushed away to the off side for a single
short and on off, cut away powerfully to the off side
slower ball, short of a length and outside off, angled to third man for a single. Bit of seam movement there and this is the 42nd over. Good sporty pitch this, something in there for everyone

cut away to point and they go for a quick single, Oram picks it up above hs head but again, yet again, a New Zealand fielder can't get a direct hit. Almost another overthrow. They've not been at their accurate best today. WIll it cost them?
tapped away to the off side, the length has been on the shorter side and the batsmen finding the gaps square of the wicket
full this time and driven down the ground for an easy single

crackling loft, tossed up and Jayawardene stands tall and flicks it exquisitely in the midwicket gap for a four. He moved well across the stumps and nailed the gap. Not timed as well as he would have liked but the placement was crucial
quicker, faster, batsman doesn't take any risks and pushes it back to the bowler
driven to long-on for an easy single
full again and driven for another single. Boundary done and the batsmen concentrating on the singles. Sensible
sweeps from middle and raps him on the pads, huge appeal for lbw but Rudi Koertzen turns it down. Close but that might have missed leg. Some turn for Patel and he's varying his pace well

cut away savagely, that was a tad too short. The ball races away towards the third man fence but James Franklin cuts it off and keeps them down to a couple. Their ground fielding has been OK but it's been the inability to crack the direct hits that may cost them
short of a length, glided away to third man for a single
Dilshan backs away and whacks it to the off side for another single. He has this baseball technique that can unnerve bowlers
full and Jayawardene does what he's done so well throughout this innings, drives it solidly down the ground
good length and slightly wide, cut away to point where Fleming misfields and allows a single. The wheels seem to be coming off now

Take that! Shot of the day so far. Full and Jayawardene stands and delivers a most emphatic loft, super timing, pendulum-smooth swing of the bat and no fielder can get close to that. Soars over the boundary for a mighty six
cut away but straight to the square fielder
pushed to mid-on for a single, Patel's last over this

tapped to cover and Hamish Marshall goes for the direct hit. Had he hit Dilshan would have been running all the way back to the pavilion but no New Zealander has managed the direct hit today and Marshall joins the list

dropped, full toss, Jayawardene whips it across the line and Shane Bond, standing a few yards in front of the tops at third man, not only muffs the catch but also taps it over the ropes for a six. That's what's called being paid for ones mistakes, and so quickly
worked away for a single, he has done this so well all day - four followed by single
that's deft, very deft. Full and on off, Dilshan angles his bat beautifully and gets it past short third man for another four. Pump up the volume!
pushed down the ground to long-off for a single, yet another ocassion when a four is followed by a single. Best policy that - the aussies seem to do it always.

yet another unlucky decision, this time from Taufel. Full and drifting down the legs, Dilshan tries to paddle it past short fine but can't make contact. The ball strikes his back leg and is swinging away all the time. It might have gone on to clatter into the fifth stump (on the leg side) but Taufel raises his finger. Not again, Dilshan seems to be saying.
worked away to the leg side for a single, short of a good length and flicked away
awww! that would have got the purists purring, full and over-pitching, Mahela pushes forward and creams it wonderfully past cover for a boundary. Sweet as candy, he can strike them with class
angled away to third man for an easy single. Remember the strategy? Four first, single later
full ball, driven back to the bowler, Oram uses his reach and stops it well
slower ball but he over-steps, outside off and Arnold can't make contact while going for the cut.
short of a length, straight ball, Arnold tries to deflect it towards point but it's straight to the cover fielder
short of a length, outside off, allows Jayawardene the chance to free his arms and slash it square of the wicket, sweeper mops up as they complete an easy single
slower ball, full on off, driven through cover for a single
full and outside off, McCullum is standing upto the stumps now, driven crisply through covers but Patel cleans up well. Keeps them to a single
speared down leg side, wide called. Good take by McCullum, though, standing up.
tries for the full ball but it's just a good length ball wide of off, Jayawardene backs away and flashes and most effective flash. It's another four as the ball races away behind square
full toss and that was surely above waist. Not called no-ball, though. Some sloppy umpiring going on. McCullum taken by surprise while standing up but handles it well.

timing, glorious. Used the pace of the bowler smartly. Outside off again and Mahela back-cuts it quite gorgeously for a four square of third man. This is an outstanding shot. Class showing here, and he has oodles of it
full and outside off, dug out and a single to off
tapped away past cover for another single
full and too straight, fine leg up and all Arnold has to do is turn those wrists and beat the fielder. Bond coming apart at the slog, Sri Lanka surging.
slower ball, full and wide, Arnold tries to glide it towards third man but misses. The ball reaches the keeper on the first bounce.
slightly slower ball again, Arnold seems to have decided to pat it to the off side but can't adjust to the line in the last minute, pushes it back to the bowler
full again outside off, driven to long-off for a single
Arnold trying to be a bit too cute here, short ball outside off and he tries to glide it to third man, can't get to the ball
full and on middle stump, Arnold digs it out and pushes it to long-on, Taylor cleans up well and restricts them to a single
another cute shot and Mahela hurting them with silk here. Full on off and Mahela sweeps it past short fine leg for a delectable four.
short ball and he pulls, top edge balloons over short fine for another brace. He moves on to 99. What an innings

Crack! What a way to bring it up, wide and slightly short and he cuts it smoothly past point, bisecting the fielders on the boundary. He knows that's going for four and pumps his fists and jumps up in delight. This innings has been worth its weight in gold.
driven to long-off for a single and keeps the strike. Another four followed by another single. Sensible, very sensible
too wide, too short and all Jayawardene needs to do is back away and flash, flash flash. Races away to the square boundary for yet another four.
Jaywardene moves across the stumps, Bond follows him but over-compensates. Wide called

Too easy for him now. That was a zingler. Full toss, waist high and Jayawardene blitzes it with another smooth swing, just clears the midwicket ropes and Patel can't get around to it. Taufel indicates six after checking with the third umpire
wide of the stumps here, short ball and Jayawardene can't get onto it for the pull this time.
chipped to long-on and it drops short of Taylor. They complete a single
it's raining fours now, Arnold flicks it past short fine leg, can't bowl length at this time and what on earth is fine leg doing in the circle? Four all the way
low full toss, chipped away to extra cover for a single. That's the end of the innings and they end on an imposing 289

inn2.comm: swing straight away, into the right-handed Fulton, slight inside edge onto the pads
full and on off, defended confidently
Huge appeal from Vaas. Good full, swinging ball swinging back into Fulton. Inside edge again and that save him. That was going on to crash into middle and leg but Taufel spotted the edge
straight and full again, swinging in and a thick edge trickles to the leg side for a single.

And that was so close! short of a length and Fleming went forward when he should have been better off going back, edge flies wide of the lone slip and Malinga cleans up at third man. That was so close to yet another duck against Vaas
tucked to the leg side but Arnold covers the ground well to stop any chance of a single
full ball to start with. It appears often that Malinga either bowls them full or short, no half measures. Fleming pushes to mid-off
pacy straight away, short of a good length and moving into the left-hander, beating him for pace and nestling in his pads.

Got 'em, that was a ripper! Full and pacy, close to 150kph, pitching on off and moving in. Fleming can't read the movement and bat is nowhere near the ball as it crashes into his front pad. Massive appeal and Koertzen raises the slow finger of death. Replays indicate that the ball was going on to hit the top of off. Fleming gone. Big wicket
What was that? Waqar Younis in disguise? Full ball at 142kph and Taylor is squared up completely. Ball is full and beats the outside edge all ends up. That was a quick legbreak, Taylor quite bemused
Another one, this time it's shorter in length and Taylor on the back foot but he can't get anywhere close as the ball pitches on middle and moves away viciously. Cracking ball

And again ... Malinga bwoling some magic balls here but Taylor playing inside the line. Suddenly the overcast conditions helping swing and seam. New Zealand facing a big total and a lethal new-ball pairing
Short of a length, swinging in, Fulton can't middle it, another inside edge. He's definitely uneasy here.
good line from Vaas, as one would expect. Fulton pushes to midwicket and scampers a quick single.
full ball outside off, not that much swing that time, Taylor pushes forward and pats it towards mid-on.

short of a length, moving in this time, defended cautiously to the off side, no run again. It's early days yet but the pressure gradually mounting. Murali is already warming up. It's only the third over, isn't it?
tapped back to the bowler, short of a length and on the money, Vaas knows how to hit the right areas day in and day out
down the leg side and the batsmen try to sneak a single, Malinga is prowling there and throws a quick return back to the keeper. Nearly a mix-up there but Taylor makes his ground in time
Quick again but the bounce was pretty low on that ocassion, outside off and Fulton lets it go. The ball reaches the wicketkeeper on the second bounce.
Slightly slower, 139kph and it's wide of off, Fulton shoulders arms again. With Malinga, you never know what to expect.
Scorcher, short and that flew off the pitch. Variable bounce here and that's dangerous for New Zealand. Sangakkara can't get his hands to it and can only parry it away to the fine-leg boundary. Zoom
Jaffa! That was unplayable, short of a length and seaming viciously. No way you can even touch those. Fulton simply can't get his bat onto it.

Edged and dropped. Fulton drives at a full one and gets a thickish edge. Antother full and fierce delivery and the bowler does his bit. But Arnold diving to his left at second slip grasses the chance. That should have been taken. Malinga was unlucky
drifting down leg, flicked away for a single to fine leg
short of a length and swinging in, Vaas again on the ball, patted to the on side and straight to the fielder
tucked away to the leg side but well fielded at short midwicket. No runs
short of a length, straight. Vaas and accuracy go hand in hand. Driven off the back foot to the bowler
on the back foot, driven down the ground, goes past the bowler but it's straight to mid-on
similar line, slighty fuller, angled away to the off side but can't beat cover
fine finish to a tight over, on the back foot and tucked away to short midwicket. Drip, drip

And the jaffas continue. Taylor can only smile, Malinga returns the smile too. Full ball, pacy, swinging, seaming away. Taylor can't even think of putting bat into that. Mohammad Asif, Glenn McGrath are you watching?
short of a length and seaming away again, Taylor gets an outside edge past second slip for a single
full ball, batsman pokes tentatively, can't get to it. This is quite an unplayable spell from Malinga. Strange he's just had one wicket. He's probably delivered close to ten scorchers
short of a length on off, patted back to the bowler. One of the few that managed to find the middle of the bat

glided away to third man for a single, short of a length again. The issue is how often does one go on the back foot, considering the dangerous yorker that he possesses? Don't bet against it anytime soon.
This is so regular that it's getting boring. Squared him up yet again and Taylor plays inside the line yet again, only to see the ball zoom past his outside edge

just short of the short midwicket. The short leg fielder was in place in the last over but strangely he isn't there anymore. Fulton pushes tentatively away from his body and the ball drops short of the short midwicket fielder
slightly short, Fulton goes for the pull but plays over the ball and Sangakkara, standing upto the stumps, picks it up well
tapped to the off side from the back foot. Vaas is turning in an immaculate spell, giving support to Malinga's speedy one at the other end
tucked away behind square for a single, that was slightly off target, drifting into his pads

full ball, this time on middle stump, defended to the leg side and the ball goes straight to short midwicket. Bat close to his pad and had that missed bat, there would have surely been a roaring appeal from the Sri Lankans
slightly wide and Taylor pulls out the flash, all the way to third man for a single
Malinga oh Malinga, what does he need to do to get a wicket? Short of a length, outside off, it's muggy overhead and Taylor pushes in a circumspect fashion. Can't get an edge, can't get the middle.

beaten again, he seems to have no clue there. The good thing here is that Taylor is playing inside the line every time. This one leaves him just a shade and the keeper and slips can only moan in frustration.

Another positive: Taylor keeps getting beaten and smiling like a kid at a chocolate factory. Drives but is beaten this time, again to the one that leaves him. Malinga continues to smile at the other end
Slower ball this time and Taylor it seems has decided to take him on, way down the track and is beaten again. Whatever he tries, he's just not putting bat to ball. When it's not your day ...

Now this is getting so unbearable, Malinga is not only continuing to turn out cracking deliveries that are beating the outside edge but also managing an impish smile. Short of a length, Taylor pushes, beaten.
Celebration time! Taylor has middled a ball. Short of a length and finally, after what seemed an age, has got the ball on the meat of the bat
tucked away to the leg side for a single

rare rare wide delivery from Vaas, full and wide of off stump and taylor frees his arms well. it must come as a relief after the torment he endured against Malinga. He times them crisply Taylor and that breezes away to the cover fence
driven to mid-on for a single
patted to the cover fielder, short of a length again from Vaas (that's what he's ben doing so well in this innings)
ful ball, on middle and leg, driven wide of mid-on for a single

good length ball, Taylor continues to play inside the line of the ball. Can't term that "well left". It can be a tricky tactic that because Vaas is so good at moving it both ways. Taylor might well have not accounted for the straighter one that time
full and wide outside off, over-stepping too. Fulton jabs it to the point region

Fernando spears it in full at 85.6mph, not much swing for him, he's more a lumbering hit-the-deck types. Fulton drives, on the up and past the bowler for a crisp four. Fernando tries to get his hands to it but it's too far to his right.
goes for the drive again but beaten, not to the pitch and can't get bat on ball
worked away to the leg side, straight to the fielder
full ball, driven neatly back to the bowler. Koertzen warns Fernando for running on the danger area. First official warning for him. Two more such instances and he can't bowl for the innings.
over-steps again, problems for him here
driven to third man for a single
over-steps yet again. All sort of problems. What does he think of? The over-stepping or the danger area or the batsman or the ball? Short of a length, defended back to the bowler
full ball on the off, driven wide of mid-on for a single. End of an eventful over.
Full ball on off, pushed back down the ground.
good length ball on middle and leg, inside edge onto pad deflects to third man, batsmen try a quick single and take Dilshan on. He can't get the direct hit and they make it home

Hook, line and sinker! Taylor hasn't had the best time out in the middle and he's adjudged lbw by Taufel this time. Vaas get it at a good length and Taylor comes forward trying to whack it across the line. Misses the ball and is struck on the pads, not much deviation after pitching and the ball might have gone on to miss off but Taufel gives it out. Taylor's forgettable stay comes to an end, Vaas's accuracy is awarded with a wicket. Another debatable decision. The umpires have really struggled on the day

Another huge appeal but not given this time. Vaas from over the wicket and pitches in line but that too doesn't come back in, struck on the pads but the height was also a factor. Good decision that time
Not much swing that time, it seems to have disappeared in the last few overs. Tapped to the off side
on middle and turned away to swuare for a single
from round the stumps, lands outside leg, angles in, on middle and leg, tucked to  square-leg
Fine leg up and Fernando slips one on the hips, clipped away past the man in the circle

fuller, around off stump line, Styris goes for a drive, is a touch too hard while going through with the shot and the bottom-hand dominates and the bat-face shuts and the ball rolls away to the off side
again the bottom-hand, too much of it, and the ball rolls away to mid-off
around the off stump, Styris punches it to mid-on
tucked away in front of square for a single, on the back foot that time and from the middle of the bat
drifting on the pads, but driven straight to the fielder at short midwicket
straight and on a good length, not much room for Styris to use, is forced to drive straight to cover. The dots are piling up, so is the pressure
wide of the stumps, Styris drives but misses, Sangakkara collects cleanly and whips off the bails in a flash. Just letting the batsman know that he has to watch out where the back leg is
full and driven straight to cover, can't find the gap. That's the value that Vaas brings to the side, keeping it so tight that it results in indiscretions at the other end
tapped to the off side, fine over from Vaas, just one from it
straight and full, driven to mid-on. Fernando seems to have settled into this angle of working after a poor first over
straight ball and driven back to the bowler, he gets a hand to it to prevent any runs
slightly quicker, 143kph, on off and Fulton, going for the drive, gets it on the splice of the bat to cover
flicked away confidently from middle behind square for a brace. When the line is awry, these batsmen capitalise but they're struggling to get away the good ones
straighter again, an expected line considering the angle from where Fernando is bowling. Whipped away off his hips for a single to square
patted to cover
straight and Fulton turns it away easily for a single. He's very good off his pads and anything straight is being put away
straight and full, tapped away to the off side
Breaking the shackles. Short of a good length and Styris reads the length early, backs away and pulls a most emphatic pull towards midwicket for a cracking four. They need to step it up now
down the leg side, Styris can't get a bat to it and it deflects off the wicketkeeper towards fine leg. Wide called
pushed to mid-off, slightly airy but not for too long
finds the gap well, crisply struck through extra cover for a single
wide and full, Styris drives on the up and finds the gap through the two cover fielders, doesn't have the timing to go all the way but enough for a handy couple.
Fernando continues around the wicket, full and wide of off stump, Fulton drives but misses, they complete a bye

That was dynamite! Slightly fuller and that's all it takes for Styris to back away and unleash a mighty loft over long-on for a huge six. Now that is a statement of intent. Styris seems to be saying enough is enough
short of a length, inside edge onto his pads and they run a single. Muted appeal from Fernando
flicked away for a single in front of square
short and wide, Styris goes for the wild slash but can't reach. Close to a wide but not called
full ball and pushed confidently to mid-off
short of a length, on middle and leg, turned away square for a single

gone! catch! no-ball! drama! Malinga fires it in quick and full, Styris scoops it towards wide mid-on for a hesitant shot. it was almost he was checking the shot. Murali makes good ground and swoops down to take a magnificent diving catch at short midwicket only to get up and see the no-ball gesture. If eyes could kill ....
pushed back down the ground
full ball and driven down the ground to mid-on
mis-timed drive to mid-on
flighted ball, spinning in, defended away to the leg side
huge appeal, pitching off and middle, struck on the pads, probably going on to hit middle and leg but he was a bit too forward for that
classic doosra from Murali, Fulton tries to whip it from outside off to midwicket but can only manage a thick edge to the third man fence. Deceived all ends up
Worked away to the leg side
straight ball this time, batsman tries to glide it to the off side (strange decision with the slip in) but misses. Good take from Sangakkara
That's another zinger! The no-ball malaise continues and the full ball is deposited way over the straight boundary for a huge six. Styris went after that like a marauder on a rampage.
yet another no-ball. He had his moments with Koertzen, now he's testing Taufel. Similar problems. Styris gives himself room but can't time it this time
wide and full, Styris flashes hard, so hard that his bottom hand comes off his bat handle, can't beat the cover fielder, though
down the leg side this time, the extras malady is getting out of hand
full and wide of the stumps, Fulton drives standing tall, through the extra cover gap and they complete a couple
pushed to the off side and they manage a quick single to Jayawardene at short extra cover. Direct hit would have created problems but that hasn't happened too often today
cramped for room, short of a good length and straight, tapped to mid-on
That was a Dean Jones like flick, full and on middle, Fulton moves across and flicks it away gloriously over square leg for a sensational six. That was Fulton at his punishing best
wide and slightly short of a length, flashes and misses. No wide called. That was a 20-run over. A good one for New Zealand
Wide down the leg, good take from Sangakkara
drifting towards leg again, tipped to mid-on for a quick single
on off, Fulton flicks it wide of mid-on for another single
tapped towards cover but no run that time

footwork, timing and glory ... Styris down the track, reads the spin, picks up the doosra and goes with the loft beautifully, superbly timed the ball soars straight over the bowlers head for a crackling six
worked away for a single, sensibly done. They are nearly there with the D/L par score now
starts from around the wicket to the right-hander, speared in on middle, driven back to the bowler
full ball on off, swept away backward of square for a single
on the back foot, not much spin for Jayasuriya, tapped away towards cover
driven past mid-on for a single, sensibly done
on the back foot again, fast ball and slightly short of a length, driven through the covers for a single
Fast ball on middle and off, tucked away to the leg side
pushed to the off side for a single, through the covers
pushed to short midwicket

There's the break in the partnership! Dilshan has done his job here. Styris tries to chip it over short midwicket after advancing down the track but Jayawardene is waiting there at short midwicket, timing his jump to perfection and pulling off a crucial catch. Styris is the man in form but Dilshan removes him there
full ball on off, this time around the wicket with a slip in place, driven back to the bowler
fired in on the pads, worked away to the on side
over the wicket to the left-hander, full on off, Oram off the mark with a tap to the off side
round the wicket for the left-hander, tucked away to the leg side
pitching on leg and turning away, wide called and rightly so.
Jayasuriya bounding in now, and firing those customary darts. On off and pushed to cover
driven down the ground to wide mid-off for a single
pushed square off the back foot and they think of two but decide against it in the end
full ball on off, turned away past the square fielder for a single. Good stop but he can't stop the single
flighted on off, not that much spin, Oram pushing it to the off side for another single
turned to the leg side, the full balls are being easily dealt with here
flighted from middle to off, struck on the pads and a huge appeal goes up but umpire Koertzen doesn't entertain that

The doosra does it, turning into the left-hander, full and on off and Oram pushes it back tentatively. It loops back low to Murali and he latches on well, tapping it form his right to left hand as he juggles the catch. Murali's second good catch of the innings and the first one that produces a wicket. There's a certain joy in his eyes when he pouches them.

Doosra again, and another wicket. McCullum goes for the sweep from off to leg and doesn't seem to have read the one that's leaving him. Ball balloons up off the top edge and Chamara Silva, prowling at short fine leg, moves quick and pulls off a sensational diving catch. It was dipping quickly but he lunged full length and held on.
full toss outside leg, McMillan is seriously incapicitated here. It's not the best position to come into
tapped off the back foot

gone! this has the makings of a collapse here. Quick ball on middle and leg, Fulton chips one tamely and Jayawardene back peddles to take a simple catch at short midwicket. That was a soft dismissal and New Zealand wobbling against spin here.
Full ball on off, driven down the ground back to the bowler
glided to short third man for a single
defended to the off side, they decide against the single
around the wicket with vultures prowling around the bat, tapped to the on side
doosra pitched on off and turning away, McMillan fends cautiously and is beaten
worked away to the leg side

it's the doosra again and cleans him up, Vettori doesn't read it and pushes forward tentatively, the ball is spinning into him and, though he is well forward, that would have gone on to hit the stumps. Rudi Koertzen is at it again - raising the slow hand of death. He was forward but he was also quite plumb
offbreak this time, pitched on off and turning away, left alone
full and on middle, tucked away to the leg side
tapped away to the off side
some turn for Jayasuriya, into Franklin's pads, worked away square for a single

That was smoked over midwicket! McMillan gives himself some room and takes a big, big swipe at a ball that's full and on off, soars way over midwicket for a six. He is in pain, though, and holds his stomach in a grimace
on the pads and whipped away past short fine leg for a four this time. Burning against the raging light? We will know soon
full ball on off, that was the offspinner and Franklin drives it confidently down the ground to long-off for a single
around the wicket to the right-hander, pitching on leg, McMillan defends it back to the bowler
offbreak pitching on off, turned away in front of square for a single
offspinner to Franklin, he can't read it and lets it go to the keeper
worked away to the leg side for a single
full ball outside off, tapped away past the slip to third man for a couple
good length ball on off, Franklin pushes it to cover for a single
continues over the wicket to the right-hander as well, turned away behind square for a single
defended to the off side for a single
good length ball, pushed down the ground past the bowler for a single
defended back to the bowler
patted to the off side
tapped away towards short leg
drives through the off side but manages only an inside edge, no run
bat and pad close together, pushing forward, no run there
an offspinner that pitches on middle, McMillan backs away and misses, the ball spins too much and misses leg. That was dangerous
doosra and that was close! Pitched on off and spinning back, Franklin sees it at the last moment and gets his bat down just in time
That was rustic and effective. McMillan walking away from the stumps, seizing a good length ball from Jayasuriya and clobbers it with a horizontal bat, way over the bowler's head for a big six.

It's over! McMillan tries a similar shot but Jayasuriya fires it in quicker, almost a seam up. It's a slog and he can't make contact with it, the ball zooms on and rattles leg stump. Jayasuriya lets out a whoop of delight. McMillan hobbles back (and it seems NZ are in a similar state)
swept away for a single from outside off to in front of square
full ball on off, tucked away airily past short midwicket for a couple. Dilshan dives gallantly but can't complete what would have been a spectacular catch
driven down the grund to long-off
Murali around the wicket, pitches on off and Bond taps it for a single towards the covers
pitched outside off and turning away, Franklin back-cuts it to short third man
full ball and swept away for a single to the sweeper fielder

That's the offbreak and that's cleaned him up in a daze. Pitched on off and turning prodigiously, gap between bat and pad and that's enough for the Murali menace to sneak through and rattle the middle stump. The end is near now. Very near in fact.
tapped back to the bowler
offbreak on middle, turned into him, struck the pads and popped up to the short leg fielder
worked away to the leg side for a single
full ball on middle, pushed back down the ground
tucked away to short midwicket, Dilshan, even at this point, dives himself full length and stops it
single again but the Sri Lankan fans are already celebrating with gusto. They know it's just a matter of time before the final nail is hammered
full ball on off, whipped away towards midwicket for a single. In the air but no fielder there
worked away to the leg side, tough chance for Arnold at short leg but he can only get a hand to it
turning away from middle to leg, turned away to short fine for a single
defended back to the bowler
pulled straight into Arnold at short leg and it trickles away for a couple. Good he's wearing a helmet
driven confidently to mid-on
tries to paddle it around the corner but it's on off and he can only get his pad to it
charges down the ground and whistles it over Murali at mid-on for a boundary. He jumps up but can't get his hands to it
worked away, all this is eating into Sri Lanka's celebration time it seems. The spectators aren't too concerned now, busy with their dancing
driven down the ground
short and pulled away behind square
pitched on off, spinning in, on the back foot and pushed to short midwicket
turned to midwicket for a single
tucked away for another single to midwicket
slightly short, Patel goes for the pull but only manages an inside edge onto his pads
driven confidently towards cover
Short and cut away for a single
full and outside off, fending and poking, outside edge flies away but in the gap. Wide of the slips and to the third man region
short again and, though it's too close to cut, Franklin ramps it superbly over the lone slip into third man for a one-bounce four
driven to the off side
square driven and Franklin thinks of a single, Dilshan picks up wonderfully at gully and lets rip. Had he hit it would have all been over. But today hasn't been a day for the direct hits.
pushed back down the ground
flighted outside off, chipped away towards mid-off just beating Arnold at cover.
down the track for a single
down the track and pulled away for a single, bottom edge that time
dropped, Franklin tries to back away and cut, gets a thin edge but Sangakkara, behind the stumps, fluffs a chance. He's normally exceptional behind the stumps but he missed it this one.
full and yorker length, driven to short midwicket. That's more the Malinga we know.
turned away from middle and leg to square
full again, this time on off. Driven cleanly back to the bowler
good length on off, Patel handling this well, driving towards cover. He's batting like a No.10 and not No.11
tapped away to the off side, towards point
full and on off, Franklin is good with the bottom hand and drives it wide of mid-off for a single.
full on middle and leg, Franklin sweeps, misses, Dilshan lets out a raucous appeal but Koertzen is not too interested. Might have gone on to hit leg stump but a close call.
wide of leg stump, swept away efficiently for a four to fine leg.

down the ground to a flighted ball and smacked from the meat of the bat over long-on for another six. Patel is making the most of these moments here. The game might be gone but it's a World Cup semi-final stage and he's showing his worth
down the leg side, spinning away
Turned away to square for a single
firing it down leg side, wide called and predictably so
flat and outside off again, Patel down the ground and slashes it over extra-cover for another four. Malinga tries to cut it off but the ball goes over the ropes

scooped over Jayasuriya's head and that is heading for the boundary as well until Malinga dives full length and stops it with his extended right foot. Champions League semi-final anyone? Fine stop and they're kept down to two
full and on middle and leg, paddled away sweetly past short fine leg for another couple.
Pre-meditated reverse-sweep but that was on leg and he can't get the full range

And that's the end of that. Patel down the ground and cracks it towards long-on, not that well timed and there he's waiting - Dilhara Fernando, who had a forgettable game is there to finish it all over. He pouches the catch wonderfully and there's a wave of Sri Lankan elation at Sabina Park
